questions.question_text: A programmer wants to use a programming language in which high performance is a requirement. Which of the following language types is the BEST option?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Compiled Language is the answer. Here is a description of each. 

Markup language: Used for defining the structure and presentation of text (e.g., HTML, XML) but not for high-performance tasks.

Scripting language: Interpreted languages that are generally slower and used for automating tasks (e.g., JavaScript, Python).

Compiled language: Translated into machine code, offering high performance and efficiency (e.g., C, C++, Rust).

Interpreted language: Executed line-by-line by an interpreter, typically slower than compiled languages (e.g., Python, Ruby).

questions.question_text: A log entry indicating the deletion of a file by a user during a previous session is an example of data:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. persistence.

Persistence refers to the characteristic of data that allows it to be stored and remain available across sessions, even after a device or system is restarted. In this case, a log entry indicating the deletion of a file by a user during a previous session is an example of persistent data because the log record is saved and accessible even after the session ends.

Here's why the other options are less relevant:

A. analysis: Data analysis refers to the process of examining data to draw conclusions. While the log entry could be analyzed, the log itself represents persistent data.

B. exportation: Exporting data involves transferring data from one system to another. The log entry is not being exported; it's being stored for future reference.

C. querying: Querying involves searching or retrieving data based on specific criteria. The log entry is data, but querying is not whatâ€™s being described here.

Selected Answer: D
A log entry that records the deletion of a file by a user during a previous session is an example of persistent data because it is stored in a log file and remains available even after the session ends.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an element of a NoSQL database?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Its C. NoSQL databases can have flexible or schema-less designs, accommodating various data formats.

questions.question_text: Which of the following wireless technologies has the shortest transmission distance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. NFC (Near Field Communication)

NFC operates over very short distances, typically within a range of a few centimeters to a few inches. It is commonly used for contactless payments, ticketing, and data exchange between devices by bringing them close together.

Therefore, option A, NFC, has the shortest transmission distance compared to the other wireless technologies listed.

Selected Answer: A
A. NFC

Near Field Communication (NFC) has the shortest transmission distance among the options listed. NFC is designed for secure communication between devices over very short distances, typically a few centimeters, making it ideal for applications like contactless payments, access control, and simple data exchange between devices when they are close together.

questions.question_text: Which of the following shows how many results are possible when evaluating Boolean data types?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Two.

Boolean data types can only have two possible values: True or False. These two values are the foundation of Boolean logic, and when evaluating Boolean expressions or conditions, the result will always be either True or False.
